work_and_research.company: TRIPODS Research Program, University of Rochester
summary: Researched Kolmogorov complexity as a measure of forecastability for retail analytics time series data.
Modeled seizures and explored surrogate data testing, utilizing methods like Fast Fourier transform.

work_and_research.summary: Lead weekly sections and tutor students, create assignment rubrics, grade student work.
Managed graduate carrels, assisted patrons at front desk, processed library materials.

extracurricular.organization: Cornell Association for Women in Mathematics
extracurricular.summary: Plan, organize, and lead all social events as undergraduate Social Events Co-Chair. Coordinate and organize community events, e.g. Julia Robinson Math Festival, as Outreach Co-Chair.

One of 500 fellows (less than 4% of undergraduates) recognized by Cornell University for 'significant work experience, campus and/or community service, and academic achievement.' Volunteer for Cornell Tradition-specific events and organizations such as Prisoner Express.

Data Science Skills: * indicates skill to be learned in planned Spring '24 coursework
